fashionable.translation[0].definitions[0: popular, especially for a short period of time
Strong colours are very fashionable at the moment.
It suddenly became fashionable for politicians to talk about green issues.
it is fashionable (for somebody) to do something
fashionable.translation[0].definitions[1: popular with, or used by, rich people
He runs a fashionable restaurant near the Harbor.
fashionable.translation[0].note_box[0].s: fashionable
popular at a particular time
fashionable clothes
It was fashionable to have red hair.
His theories were fashionable in the 1980s.
trendy
modern and fashionable – often used in a slightly disapproving or joking way
a trendy tie
a trendy restaurant
The area has become very trendy and a lot of artists live there.
stylish
fashionable and well-designed in an attractive way
She was wearing a stylish two-piece suit.
The furniture looked very stylish and modern.
fashionable – used especially when you think someone or something looks good
Michael looked very cool in his dark jacket and sunglasses.
a cool shirt
happening
a happening place is fashionable and lively
London has always been a happening place.
be in fashion
to be fashionable at a particular time
The Sixties look is back in fashion.
in
fashionable at a particular time. In  is not used before a noun, except in the phrases below
Pale colours are in.
New York was the in place to be.
Yoga has become the in thing to do.
fashionable.translation[1].definitions[0: It has became fashionable for politicians to talk about green issues.
